str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
From an obsolete particle ne- and epos; not speaking, i.e. An infant; figuratively, a simple-minded person, an immature Christian.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A nurse. From trepho; a nourisher, i.e. Nurse.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (properly: I warm, then) I cherish, nourish, foster, comfort. Probably akin to thallo; to brood, i.e. to foster.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular

str2: A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
